response:
The tree costs \$90 to plant.  
Each year it yields 7 lemons, sold at \$1.5 each â†’ revenue per year = \(7 \times 1.5 = \$10.5\).  
The tree requires \$3 of irrigation/nutrients per year.  
Thus the net profit per year is \(10.5 - 3 = \$7.5\).

We need the number of years \(n\) such that the cumulative net profit equals the initial planting cost:

\[
n \times 7.5 = 90 \quad\Rightarrow\quad n = \frac{90}{7.5} = 12.
\]

So after 12 years the tree breaks even; the next year it will start making a profit.

#### 12
